This National Project in Agricultural Communica¬
tions, known as NPAC, stems from and centers
around the land-grant colleges and universities, the
United States Department of Agriculture, and related
organizations of business and industry.
Through NPAC, these institutions and organizations
can rally both human and material resources to im¬
prove communications and to stimulate and facilitate
professional work in this area.
NPAC’S program continues to develop within the
framework of its major objective:
“To assist administrators and information
workers in our land-grant institutions and
the United States Department of Agriculture
in using present and potential communica¬
tions more effectively and efficiently in ex¬
tending to the entire public the services and
facilities of their institutions.”
By resolution, the NPAC board defines project oper¬
ations and relations as ". . . to work with everyone
who can be of assistance in the planning and execu¬
tion of project activities.”
